boardgame.name: Unsolved Cases
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"A heist of a lifetime goes wrong when you are double crossed by your employer. Are you able to find out why you were sold out before the cops catch you?"

"An heir to a rich family is found dead, stuffed into a carryall bag. While the police are cluelessly stumbling in the dark, the family hires you to find the killer."

"The mayor of the City offers you a job: stop a journalist from writing scoops about the mayor. If during the process you happen to find out how exactly the journalist gets his material, all the better."

Unsolved Cases is a collection of six case file scenarios to run for Grim Noir RPG.The case files included can be run as short, one session long, adventures or they can be built upon by the GM to create a bigger, and more complex, case. Either way each case contains a description of the mystery that needs to be solved and an outline of what is really going on behind the scenes.

Each case can be broken down to the following parts:
Mystery: The main focus and goal of the case.What are the investigators trying to find out or solve.

What is really going on?: Who and what is causing the mystery behind the scenes.

Characters: Non-player characters that play a crucial role in the mystery.

Locations: Places in the City that hold clues to solve the case.

Clues: Pieces of information that can be gathered by the investigators. Clues will tell what is really going on, but they might not help make the final decisions on how to solve the case. That decision is always left up to the investigators.

Unsolved Cases features:

Six adventure scenarios
Key NPC descriptions
Key Location descriptions
Core Clues


Case File Scenarios Included:
Too Angry to Die: You are hired to find out the identity of a stalker, but something feels off about the case from the very beginning. Why ask you and not go to the police?

Web of Memories: A man with amnesia is accused of thievery, but claims that he has no memory of what happened, or who he even is. The public defender’s office hires you to investigate what is really going on, and to provide proof of his innocence before the upcoming trial.

Cheated: A heist of a lifetime goes wrong when you are double crossed by your employer. Are you able to find out why you were sold out before the cops catch you?

Bodybag: An heir to a rich family is found dead, stuffed into a carryall bag. While the police are cluelessly stumbling in the dark, the family hires you to find the killer.

Curiosity Kills the Cat: The mayor of the City offers you a job: stop a journalist from writing scoops about the mayor. If during the process you happen to find out how exactly the journalist gets his material, all the better.

Rainy Days Have Come: A recent widow believes her husband hid a sizable rainy day stash, and hires you in hopes of finding the money her husband left behind. Interrogating the ghost of the late husband seems like the best place to start.

boardgame.name: Sorcerous Origin: Reincarnate Soul
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Under rare circumstances, a powerful soul suffused with arcane magic will persist beyond a single life. As a sorcerer masters their magical abilities, they may find these experiences familiar when they begin to remember fragments of their past lives. These past lives are seldom identical in personality, though, and a Reincarnate sorcerer may even find themself capable of consulting the spirits of these past lives for guidance and unique perspectives of the world lost to shorter-lived souls.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a sorcerer character, the Reincarnate Soul allows a player to build a sorcerer whose power comes from a cycle of reincarnation, allowing them to remember powers from past lifetimes. This PDF also contains a new metamagic option for all sorcerers to cast more persistent spells.

boardgame.name: Henchfolk & Hirelings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the henchfolk and hirelings in your campaign.

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 19 - Jan 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not only do we have advice for those of you who are starting off on their Games Master/Dungeon Master journey but we also have a huge (13 pages) adventure to kick start The Tears of Ishme Adventure Path, which will build to form an entire adventure / campaign. Each episode can be used as a stand alone side quest or one-shot adventure and there are 5e stats for the creatures and key NPCs included

Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral (adventure has 5e stats) Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Being a Games Master - Multiple points of advice for the new GM

Digital Tool Box - A review of a handy online monster generator for 5e

12 Adventure Hooks

Tears of Ishme, Adventure Path Episode One - four part side trek (13 pages) with 3 new creatures with full stats (5e) and a fully detailed NPC including stat block (5e)

5 detailed NPCs

4 New creatures as encountered by Hal and Roger

How to Design and Encounter in 10 Minutes - clear instructions for all GMs

Roll Yourself Some Trouble - how to use random tables to inject variety into your games

Picture Prompt - to trigger some creative ideas

boardgame.name: Cora's Guide to Dinosaurs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cora’s Guide to Dinosaurs is a ‘zine size guide to dinosaurs and barbarians for 5e! Unleash your rage with four new barbarian classes, from the Titan Master’s oversize mounts to the Scorpion Warrior’s mastery of the desert, command a pack of animal allies as the Beast Whisperer or ride a utahraptor into battle as the Raptor Master!

Lay giants low with new rules for colossus climbing, embrace the power of the wilderness with new feats, and brave the most hostile environments imaginable with new rules for extreme environments and deadly storms. Bring peace to the borderlands with a new campaign structure in which completed quests make regions safer, adding a layer of strategy and time management that connects your dungeon delves and monster hunts.

And as a GM, figure out how to give your setting a history that players will actually care about and engage with. Y’know that old advice from AD&D about how you should start your campaign by thinking up your setting’s creation myth? Don’t do that.

boardgame.name: Dødshus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For 4-6 players, 1st level characters

You come seeking a lost hall and the treasures that may lie within. Be wary, for you may find great sorrow and a mystery quite dire.

boardgame.name: Dungeons of Drakkenheim
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

An eldritch storm of falling stars devastated the city on that woeful eve, leaving behind a meteor that would have lasting effects. Fifteen years later, Drakkenheim is a dismal urban wasteland contaminated by otherworldly magic and haunted by hideous monsters.

boardgame.name: Return to Hearth
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A dark power stirs at the edge of creation, one that predates most of humankind. This entity, known as Desperon the Shadow, desires nothing more than to erase reality and cover the Cosmos in pure, impenetrable darkness. Not many are able to stop Desperon. It will take the combined efforts, intelligence, and willpower of a brave group of heroes to thwart the shadow.

boardgame.name: Scarlet Halls
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Crusade's fiercest warriors, those who have held their ground and fought to defend the monastery throughout these dark times, are rapidly preparing an army within the Scarlet Halls.

boardgame.name: Scarlet Monastery
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Crusade's fanatical leaders direct their followers from the Scarlet Cathedral, at the heart of the monastery grounds. This heavily guarded location functions as the order's headquarters, and some of the most zealous and intolerant crusaders roam the halls of this once-hallowed place.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Design Dash #2: Crumbling Dungeon of the Ice Bees: Power Behind the Drone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A classic adventure for old school fantasy gaming, suitable for 4-6 players of 1st level.

Dan and Paul, the Wandering DMs, have at last conquered the challenge of stocking an entire dungeon in a single 2 hour episode of their weekly live stream. Here is the output of their second Dungeon Design Dash challenge, a short adventure into the lair of giant sentient frozen bees. Can the players rescue the captives of the malicious Ice Bee Queen, or will they find themselves subjugated into her army of drones?

boardgame.name: Allies & Adversaries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time for another issue!!! The Heroes and Villians and the Heroes turned Villians of yesteryears. In these action packed pages you'll find First Level and Monster versions of Dagger, Dart, Eagle, Ghast, Galaxy Gal, Marksman, Golden Gal and my own home campaign PC: Protonic. BUT WAIT, there's more: a comic strip starter scene!!!

boardgame.name: Castaway
boardgame.description:
A cooperative island survival game originally described and published as part of the webcomic Leftover Soup. Players navigate on and around the island searching for useful items and resolving dangerous events. Roll to move, items and events drawn from a common deck. Goal is to find the specific items to spell "HELP" on the beach and attract a rescue.

—user summary

boardgame.name: SuperFolio 1: Vortex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Follow the exciting adventures of Vortex from Levels 1-10. Read some highlights of "his" life as an android. Delight in the arc of adventure that awaits you in these pages!

boardgame.name: Space Station Phoenix
boardgame.description:
Space Station Phoenix is a worker-placement and resource management game set in one of Earth’s possible futures. The players are representatives of the Galactic Council, sent to Earth to build space stations to observe and perhaps interact with humanity.

Players begin the game with nine ships and a station hub. These ships act as action spaces that players use to gather resources, explore the nearby planets, and build their stations. Turns are fast and straightforward; either take ship action or take income.

Many games start players off with a small resource engine which they build up to a bigger one. In Space Station Phoenix, players start with the best production engine they will ever have and proceed to break it down part by part. As the game progresses, their actions get more efficient, but the number of ways to take those actions starts to diminish.

Space Station Phoenix also features deep re-playability with millions of possible starting positions and station parts combinations.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Game weight: 2.760 kg
New in shrink.

Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 20-30 euro, depending on location, and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Wars: The Prophetess
boardgame.description:
Part of CW Onslaught 3 Stretch Goal Box

To Obtain the The Prophetess Loyalty Card: Pay 2 Doom to take this Loyalty Card, then place the Prophetess into any area on the Map.

Powers:

Hierarchy (Ongoing): The Prophetess generates 1 Power during the Gather Power Phase. She can be Captured like any Cultist and is Recruited rather than Summoned. She cannot Create or Control Gates.

True Vision (Doom Phase): The player with the highest-ranked Unit in the Area with the Prophetess can pay extra Power when performing a Ritual of Annihilation. That player gains 1 additional Elder Sign for every 3 (additional) Power spent. Unit rank in order from lowest to highest is Cultist, Monster, Terror, Independent Great Old One, Faction Great Old One. In case of a tie, no one benefits from True Vision.
Notes: Once the Prophetess' Loyalty card is in play, any player can Recruit her (she still belongs to the Faction which has this Loyalty Card).

boardgame.name: Szilaj: Kalandok Miraderoban
boardgame.description:
It's time to explore this magical world with Lucky, Pru, Abigail and more, as they take on the role of the well-known characters and their fearless horses. You'll have to explore an exciting and ever-changing board with your speeding steed, where exciting quests will set your goals. Along the way, you'll gain new experience, learn new skills that will help you control your horse with increasing skill and use increasingly valuable dice.

In the three permanent locations, you can take on quests that will earn you skill cubes as you ride to a specific spot on the board. The one who not only speeds like a wind sprinter, but learns the fastest by mastering the art of riding, will be the winner in the end!

The basic version is for those new to the game, while more experienced riders can quickly move on to the advanced version, where event cards add even more variety and challenges, as well as rewards and knowledge to collect. Learn tricks and jump over the biggest roadblocks and the widest chasms!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Eljött a pillanat, hogy Lucky, Pru, Abigél és több jól ismert szereplő bőrébe bújva, félelmet nem ismerő lovaikkal felfedezhetitek ezt a varázslatos világot. Egy roppant izgalmas és minden játék során változó táblát kell felfedezz száguldó paripáddal, ahol izgalmas küldetések fogják kijelölni céljaidat. Menet közben új tapasztalatokat szerzel, új képességeket tanulsz meg, aminek köszönhetően egyre ügyesebben irányítod majd lovadat, és egyre értékesebb dobókockákat fogsz tudni használni.

A három állandó helyszínen küldetéseket tudsz felvenni, amelyek révén képességkockákat szerzel, ha ellovagolsz értük a tábla meghatározott pontjára. Aki nem csupán szélvészként száguld, de a leggyorsabban tanul, elsajátítva a lovaglás művészetét, az lesz a végén a győztes!

A játékkal még ismerkedőknek szól az alapverzió, míg a rutinosabbak gyorsan belevághatnak a haladó változatba, amelynek során eseménykártyák hoznak még nagyobb változatosságot, és újabb kihívásokat, meg persze begyűjthető jutalmakat és ismereteket. Tanulj trükköket és ugrass át a legnagyobb útakadályok és a legszélesebb szakadékok fölött is!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bridges to Nowhere 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
In Bridges to Nowhere 2nd Edition, two engineers draft bridge parts and design bridges over a series of contests to accumulate objective cards worth victory points. The first player to score 5 victory points, wins.

Bridges to Nowhere 2nd Edition is a reimplementation of Bridges to Nowhere to specifically enhance the dueling experience with secret scaling goals, a variety of designing paths, and more interactive drafting decisions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: A Ballad of Roses
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The waters of Vylbrand have always been perilous, ever more so since, after the Calamity, the lighthouse of Pharos Sirius has gone dim.

Despite their best efforts Naldiq & Vymelli's, Limsa Lominsa's renowned ironworks, have only failed over the years to reclaim their insular guide, due to the ferocious wildlife and the noxious aether permeating the building.

But as words have it a lalafellin scholar of incredible talent has recently joined their efforts, with an invention that might turn the tides for the better. Now they only need a team of talented adventurers to secure the area and restore a safe route towards the shores of Limsa Lominsa.

boardgame.name: Gnome Improvement
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The gnomes of Zuggaby!! (yes, the "!" is part of the town'sname) have lived underground for centuries, just the same asmost other peoples in the world of Pagrodin. However, in allthat time, they never figured out how to hold the "lessgnomely" citizens who broke one of their very few rulesaccountable. After all, breaking a rule usually happens byaccident, and no gnomely gnome wants to be a prison guard,so the less gnomelies are usually given community service asa consequence. If they perform their duties well, they can beconsidered just as gnomely as the average gnome.

boardgame.name: Szilaj: A titkos küldetés
boardgame.description:
The mechanics of the game are simple: at the start of each round, you must turn over one more card than you are playing, and everyone from the current starter on up picks one. There are a variety of cards on the table from which you can score points, and the type and suit of cards you collect in front of you is very important.

Your goal will be to compose as clever combinations as possible to represent the characters, horses, objects and locations of our story. In the starter game, you'll quickly and easily master the basics of the game, which you can later deepen in the advanced mode with extra cards and new combinations. Mysterious secret missions will also be unlocked, giving you additional points at the end of the game if you complete them.

Whoever collects the most valuable deck of cards wins the game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

A játék mechanizmusa egyszerű: minden kör elején fel kell csapjatok eggyel több lapot, mint ahányan játszotok, és az aktuális kezdőjátékostól kezdve mindenki választ belőle egyet. Sokféle kártya kerül az asztalra, amiből pontokat tudtok összegyűjteni, és nagyon fontos, hogy milyen típusú és színű lapokat gyűjtötök össze magatok elé.

A célotok az lesz, hogy minél ügyesebb kombinációkat komponáljatok történetünk szereplői, lovai, tárgyai és helyszínei megjelenítésével. A kezdőjáték során nagyon gyorsan és könnyedén elsajátíthatjátok a játék alapjait, amit később a haladómódban mélyíthettek el plusz kártyák és újabb kombinációk segítségével. Előkerülnek a rejtélyes titkos küldetések is, amelyekkel további pontokra tehettek szert a játék végén, ha teljesítetek őket.

Aki a legértékesebb kártyasort gyűjtötte össze, az nyeri a játékot!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Scars of the Twelveswood
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Seventh Umbral Calaimity has brought waste into Eorzea. Five years have passed, but the world has hardly come back to normal.

But even if attacks from the beast, or skirmishes with the empire at the Ala Mhigan border are somewhat common in the Twelveswood, a brutal murder and disfigured body is more than enough to unsettle the Elementals and raise the alarm.

Will your party uncover the mystery behind this gruesome finding? Or will they be the next victim of the Shroud's killer?

boardgame.name: Mansion of the Mad Mage
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Driven mad through their attempts to control a power beyond their plane, one mage loses the fight to contain the threats they’ve uncovered. What’s left is a mansion cursed by flames barely contained by the labyrinth of walls within.

Who is the Mad Mage? Where does the house preside? You control the adventure with flexible notes, locations, and tips for running it at various levels. Custom maps, magic skillets, and twisted encounters await your party in this 4th level dungeon module.

boardgame.name: Fire and Ice: Save Bopha from Chavrytax the Red Terror!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Bophan Army will be fighting Chavrytax's army, which she commands by scrying from within her lair and magically sending messages to her field commanders.

This battle is intended to distract Chavrytax as the party sneaks into her lair to attack her directly.

boardgame.name: Cracks in the Ice
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This encounter is a chase designed for four level 5 characters. The party, laden with precious cargo, is trying to outrun a pack of orc worg riders across a river covered in ice. The party shall succeed if they can make it across the ice river. The riders succeed if they can get the valuable cargo the party is hauling.

boardgame.name: Mystery of the Larvaenapper
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ascended from the Nine Hells, a ruby eyes called Rarkaz has settled in an abandoned mine at Deadman’s Marsh and enslaved the local muscans. Now, he sets out in the midst of the night with his followers to attack the nearby insectoid settlement of Anthill, kidnapping larvae from their cradles to prepare a ritual to open a portal to the Nine Hells. Three larvae have been acquired, only two are left... Players start out arriving in the town of Anthill, and must investigate the disappearances of the larvae. Having the small town, the nearby locations and their own contacts to uncover clues leading deep into Deadman’s Marsh, past the muscan village of Buzz Town and into the mine where Rarkaz prepares.

boardgame.name: The Old Ford
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This short adventure brings your party to the site of an old river crossing. In older, more heroic times, a stone bridge was standing here. This bridge was the site of a famous last stand of the hero Lepedus and his 30 shield-brothers, against an orcish horde, hundreds of years ago. Today a hermit lives there, an old woman that tends what is left of the Hero's Memorial. It is widely known, that the sword of Lepedus was magically stuck in a stone after his death, and nobody has managed to pull it out. In fact, some of the people that tried have been struck dead. Plenty of rumors surround the sword(feel free to make your own).

boardgame.name: Embouteillage
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Cette rencontre se situe après la mort d'undes personnages du groupe et qu'un.emembre du groupe porte une ancienne bouteille vide que vous leur avez donné auparavant. Le mieux étant que cette bouteille soit une fi ole de potion de soin quivient d'être utilisée après un combat diffi cileou alors un "trésor" qui dégage de la magie et qu'ielles ont trouvés durant leurs pérégrinations.

boardgame.name: À l'Ombre des Arbres
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Durant un voyage, en fi n de journée, le groupe croise la route d'un petit village d'une dizaine de maisons en bois abandonné. Pas une âme ne semble vivre ici et tout a été laissé à l'abandon, une situation inquiétante.

boardgame.name: Dormir à Poings Fermés
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Le concept de cet mini-aventure est de l'insérer au travers de l'aventure "classique" du groupe de manière à parsemer les différentes rencontres sur plusieurs jours, enfin, plutôt plusieurs nuits.

En eff et, chaque nuit où les personnages seront dans un endroit "sécurisé" (type auberge, cité, etc.), l'équipe se verra happée dans un monde onirique où leurs poigns parleront. Allons-y !

boardgame.name: Storm Lord's Wrath
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Abandoned for many years, Leilon was once a fortified settlement midway along the High Road from Waterdeep to Neverwinter.

Under the paid service of the Lord Protector Dagult Neverember, citizens of Neverwinter have returned, intent on reestablishing Leilon as a safe waypoint once more.

Unfortunately, followers of Talos have also arrived, and they’ve brought the weather with them.
boardgame.rpgseries: Beyond the Dragon of Icespire Peak

boardgame.name: Sleeping Dragon's Wake
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Despite the depredations of those in the service of the Stormlord Talos, citizens of Neverwinter continue their work to rebuild the town of Leilon and reestablish it as a fortified waypoint on the High Road between Neverwinter and Waterdeep.

However, to make matters worse, a cadre of villains devoted to both Myrkul, god of death and the Cult of the Dragon, have risen from the Mere of Dead Men to strike out as well.
boardgame.rpgseries: Beyond the Dragon of Icespire Peak

boardgame.name: Divine Contention
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The ghosts of the Swords of Leilon have returned to bring warning so you might protect their beloved town and prevent two great evils, both competing for the same prize, from wiping it from the Sword Coast once more.

You must enter the Ethereal Plane, prevent the followers of Talos and Myrkul from gaining possession of an artifact of great evil, and putdown the forces of not one, but two vile deities.
boardgame.rpgseries: Beyond the Dragon of Icespire Peak

boardgame.name: Devil's Choice
boardgame.description:
Devil's Choice is a fast-paced shedding card game which challenges players to be first to play out their hands of number cards in sequences called queues. One queue is open to begin the game, others open randomly and as many as 4 can be open at once.

Players begin the game with 8-10 number cards and a devil card which they can use to create havoc by stealing a card from another player or by blocking an open queue. Any player who doesn't have a number card to play in a sequence during their turn must lay down their cards for all to see and draw at least one card from the bank. That's when the skullduggery and the scheming begins.

Any player who plays a rare red number card into a queue earns a blind draw from a treasure trove of wild cards, devil cards and Q-cards which they can use to open new queues. First out wins and cards held by losing players count against them.

One more thing. In poker a player with a bad hand can fold. In Devil's Choice a player dealt a poor hand is the underdog who can earn double points for winning. With much to gain and little to lose the pesky underdog can take risks and torment fellow players. The game has provisions for partnership play.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Sentinel Strike
boardgame.description:
Sentinel Strike is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion for Marvel Zombies that brings the towering Sentinel robots to challenge the players! These automated hunters adapt to the players strategies, coordinating to eliminate them. To aid the players, the powerful Professor X himself joins the fight, in both Super Hero and Zombie Hero versions. And if that’s not enough, the players can even take control of Nana, the reprogrammed Sentinel!

Sentinels can be added to any scenario to bring an extra challenge to the players. These giant robots, programmed to hunt down and exterminate any mutant lifeforms, do not care about the distinction between living and dead. If it’s still moving, it’s a threat that must be eliminated.

This expansion will contain a few Sentinel-centered scenarios for both Zombie Mode (using the New York tiles from the Marvel Zombies core box) and Hero Mode (using the X-Mansion tiles from the X-Men Resistance core box). Each of the Sentinels has a unique, highly detailed game piece, measuring a whopping 12cm if standing straight.

–description from the publisher

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2023*** Contents: Kickstarter Exclusive Marvel Zombies Clash of the Sinister Six Board Game Expansion by CMON. Includes 5 Character pieces, 4 Super hero cards, 2 Zombie Hero cards, 6 Sentinel Action cards, and 2 Sentinel Spawn cards. Not a complete game. Requires Marvel Zombies to play (sold separately). Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: The Phlavorek's Lair
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Beyond the standard dangers of the Rek-toorin Dunes lies a region of uninhabitable desolation. The area is plagued by unbearable heat, unpredictable weather, unfathomable mirages, and an unseen terror known as "The Phlavorek".

boardgame.name: The Frigid Isle
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ancient sages tell of a horrifying creature in the icy waters of the north, and of the potential rewards should it ever be defeated. Whether the party finds this Isle by accident or intent, the challenge is the same: survival.

boardgame.name: Sequence: Jewish Edition
boardgame.description:
Dreidel ... Haggadah ... Grogger ... Shofar ...

In this special Jewish edition of the popular Sequence board game, players will find symbols of Jewish culture pictured on the gameboard and playing cards. The cards also provide a brief description of each symbol. Players match a picture on a card to one on the gameboard, then place a chip there. Five chips in a row wins the game! It's a wonderful learning tool as well as great fun for families and friends!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: The Painter's Geyser
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Many adventuring parties begin in a tavern, but this quest is different. A starving artist will plead for them to guide him to a nearby geyser, said to be the most beautiful sight in the region, so that he can paint it. The journey is fraught with danger and no small number of surprises.

boardgame.name: The Otrevon Assault
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Situated at the base of a large mountain range, with easy access to a slow-moving river, lies the quiet town of Otrevon. Known primarily for it's exports of limestone from the mountain, it's the kind of town where excitement and danger are hard to come by. Until last month, when a large number of demons began to appear throughout the town. Many adventurers have flocked here to fight them back and make their names as heroes, but thus far no one has found a way to stop the relentless onslaught.

boardgame.name: The Prismshard Mine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the hills to the west, many claim to hear faint tones, almost like bells, gently ringing at the edge of perception with no discernable source or direction. Hidden amongst the ruins of an orc clan, a solemn Werebear guardian keeps watch, protecting the rest of the world from invasion.

boardgame.name: The Dwarven Tomb
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the bluffs and hills below the mountains lies the secret Tomb of the great Dwarven Crafter Velosar Steelbrow. Hidden up on a bluff by secret switchbacks and several layers of protection, a great treasure awaits.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hollow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Amidst the harsh, poisonous forest, Crel-Vohr the Blight (an Adult Green Dragon) has begun his ascent to ultimate power as he builds anew, more terrible army. Not content with mere zombies or oozes, he has created a monstrous shock trooper for his main forces. The threat he poses now in nothing to what awaits in the near future. Will our heroes be able to stop him?

boardgame.name: The Temple Assault
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You have been tasked to stop the Clasped Cabal, a misled fringe sect from the Monastery of the Whole from enacting a long-lost ritual. The ritual is to strengthen a warrior - normally used to empower a chosen warrior before a crucial conflict. The empowerment causes gradual madness, so the owner of the tattoo traditionally commits ritual suicide before they go insane.

boardgame.name: The Crumbling Tower
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Orzhov Syndicate set up a chain of small banks and churches across the city, but one of them is threatening to collapse. Unfortunately, an inconsolable ghost is driving the masons away.

boardgame.name: Marvel Zombies: A Zombicide Game – Plastic Tokens
boardgame.description:
The Plastic Token Set is a Kickstarter Exclusive pack for Marvel Zombies that brings you sturdy plastic versions of all the tokens contained in the core boxes and any expansions. That’s a total of 66 tokens in 20 different types, all of them engraved and in full color!

The Plastic Token Set contains:
- 6 Activation Tokens
- 1 Exit Token
- 7 Objective Tokens
- 1 Blue Objective Token
- 1 Green Objective Token
- 1 First Spawn Token
- 5 Spawn Tokens
- 1 Blue Spawn Token
- 1 Green Spawn Token
- 3 Super Hero Spawn Tokens
- 3 Zombie Hero Spawn Tokens
- 14 Door Tokens
- 1 Blue Door Token
- 1 Green Door Token
- 9 Broken Window Tokens
- 1 Avengers Sign Token
- 1 Sentinel Hand Token
- 3 Explosive Cannister Tokens
- 1 Galactus Tracker Tokens
- 5 Galactus Destroyed Tokens

boardgame.name: Les Caves de Thraoril
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ce scénario a été publié dans Casus Belli (Issue 16 - Aug 1983). Prévu initialement pour D&D, j'ai du modifier quelques passages du texte et équilibrer certaines rencontres pour l'adapter à D&D5 tout en étant fidèle au maximum.

boardgame.name: Soothill Mines
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Death, pain, and destruction are but a taste of what the Legion of the Damned has left in their wake. A campaign that started 40 years ago by the death knight Jacobus Brokenmask in the city of Larwick is now in full swing forcing many
citizens of the country; Sinicia, to remain hidden behind the walled city of Asophis.

Promising shelter from the horrors that roam the lands; often times the true monsters are those that hide in plain sight. Asophis has become a central hub for refugees that had to forgo their careers as miners, farmers, carpenters, stonemasons..etc. As such, many of Sinicia's natural resources are no longer harvested.

The undertaker of Asophis and paladin of the Raven Queen; Indira Fae, has been granted a vision in which the war against the Legion of the Damned had concluded. In that vision, a sword of pure silver stands atop a mound of undead flesh as the morning sun rises.

boardgame.name: Dagathia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dagathia is a campaign setting [...] on a planet covered mostly by water, covered by clusters of archipelago.

boardgame.name: Cabin in the Woods
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The towns of Windholmst and Greenweald are connected by a winding path known as the Jade Road. It hugs the edges of the Witchfen: a thick forest known for housing dangerous flora and fauna. The Jade Road takes a traveller four days to trek across, but would be significantly reduced if one were to cut through the Witchfen. However, all progress made to create a path have ended in abrupt cancellation, and anyone brave - or foolish - enough to take a shortcut seldom returns without injury, madness, or worse.

boardgame.name: Gaia Steel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Gaia Steel Corporation was founded shortly after the other elemental steel corporations of Poseidon Steel, AeroSteel, and Pyro Steel were destroyed or had their secrets stolen from them. with the knowledge to create elemental steels of fire, water, and air, Torel Granitefist, often known simply as Granite, was capable of smelting an alchemical alloy capable of holding all four elements and preforming impressive feats. This alloy was an economical success and allowed Granite to form his own metallurgy empire, Gaia Steel. with increasing profits came vastly increasing power, constructs were designed to automate production and shipment, soldiers were hired and outfitted to guard these shipments and facilities, wizards and other intellectual entities were even hired to research methods to improve upon the miraculous metal and the profits it provided.

boardgame.name: Forbidden Wasteland
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
Forbidden Wasteland is a Single-Player Journaling Table-Top Role Playing Game that uses the base core rules from the Carta SRD Game System by Peach Garden Games. Adding multiple random tables to the game provides endless playability to this system.

A vast wasteland stretches out before you to the mountains in the distance. You are a Junkman in a radioactive Wasteland determined to endure and thrive in a harsh environment. You wander through the desolate badlands collecting Treasures, Resources, and Food and must be ever watchful of dangerous Encounters. It’s a difficult life but your chosen profession allows you many hours to yourself and the isolation helps to inspire your creativity.

boardgame.name: The Lost Son of Ubtao
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A forgotten son of the Chultan god rises up to try and claim the seat his father left behind, in this arachnophobic adventure.

boardgame.name: The Warlock of Firetop Mountain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Your quest is to find the Warlock's treasure, hidden deep within a dungeon populated with a multitude of terrifying monsters. You will need courage, determination and a fair amount of luck if you are to survive all the traps and battles, and reach your goal - the innermost chamber's of the Warlock's domain.

boardgame.name: The Mad Transmuter's Lab
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Amidst the hilly chaparral of the Virtan wilds, bizarre monsters roam the land. Cruel hawks with scorpion tails, wolves with many heads, and other abominations. Most horrifying of all are the humanoids, twisted beyond recognition, shrieking in rage or in pain. Foul transmutation magic taints this land.

boardgame.name: Back to the Crossroads
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You arrive at the Crossroads, as you always do, a place that is never quite the same, but never quite different, and always offers a moment's respite from the dusty trails you roam. At this one you find the ruins of an abandoned town. A beggar huddles beneath their rags and leans against the only sturdy building in view. A mottled, wasted hand holds up a tin bowl and their reedy voice fills the air between you, "We offer Gossip and Information for coin..."

boardgame.name: Magnificence
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rose creek in all its glory is little more than a mining down. Unlike other mining towns in the area this one has recently started to turn a profit. Profit and risk attracts the wrong kind of business man and anyone who is willing to stand up to them risks being shot whoever can hire the most gunman. In this town its Bartholomew Boag, a real problem for anyone that unlucky enough to meet him. This is a module for the new and upcoming

boardgame.name: A Tumba da Lamarã
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Séculos atrás, os cruéis e sádicos Lamarões previram sua eventual derrocada e tramaram um plano para sobreviver às adversidades. Retirando-se para longe da superfície, os pode-rosos membros do conselho do culto (O Círculo de Ferro) ergueram majestosas tumbas labirínticas repletas de armadilhas e guardiões formidáveis. Todos se retiraram para essas tumbas, submetidos a uma estase temporal até que seus inimigos desaparecessem do mundo. Agora, uma dessas tumbas ancestrais foi descoberta, intacta e inexplorada. Você temo que é necessário para obter os fabulosos tesouros que esperam por você na Tumba da Lamarã?

A Tumba da Lamarã é uma aventura de D&D para 4 per-sonagens de nível 14.

boardgame.name: Emerald Kingdom
boardgame.description:
You will play as the chief of one of the major Celtic clans, vying for the high crown of the Emerald Kingdom. You win by gaining the most Renown (Victory Points) over the course of 7 rounds. Gain Renown by expanding and upgrading your clan buildings, raiding and weakening your opponents, and completing unique quests.

Throughout the course of the game, you will encounter remnants of the Tuatha De Dannan's power. Arcana cards can instantly change the flow of battle and their powerful Artifacts give you a permanent upgrade based on ancient Irish gods, such as Lugh, the Dagda, and more.

Each round has up to three Seasons. During the Building Season, you can place and upgrade the buildings on your clan board. The Harvest Season lets you gather much-needed resources based on which buildings you have. Finally, the Raiding Season allows you to attack your opponent's clan, or attempt a quest through simultaneous action selection.

The key to victory is to outthink your opponents and send your Warriors where they can earn the most Renown, but be careful not to leave your precious buildings unprotected.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: In the Case of the Baby, the Test Results are in and You Are...!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

On the way to a celebration at a Temple of Aphrodite, the party stumbles upon a crowd. There they find two very attractive people fighting in the middle of the crowd: Ares and Athena. Between them is a woman who is clearly in the latest ages of her pregnancy. Ares and Athena reveal they're in the midst of arguing who is the rightful parent of the child. After a silly conversation, the two gods reveal that the best way to handle this situation is with a game of "Gauntlet", whereby two parties of "heroes" traverse each other god's labyrinth. At the end, both teams are marked as either winners or losers by their chosen god. Lastly, the adventure ends on a cliff hanger as the poor woman gives birth to a happy, healthy baby - with gold eyes and wings. Aphrodite appears and seems shocked.

boardgame.name: Night of the Loving Dead
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Night of the Loving Dead is a very silly one-shot with an emotional core. This one shot plays like a straight forward and linear sequence of fights, only to reveal the history of the "monsters".

boardgame.name: Ragefire Chasm
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ragefire Chasm extends deep below the city of Orgrimmar. Barbaric troggs and devious Searing Blade cultists once plagued the volcanic caves, but now a new threat has emerged: dark shaman. Although Warchief Garrosh Hellscream recently called on a number of shaman to use the elements as weapons against the Alliance, the chasm's current inhabitants appear to be renegades. Reports have surfaced that these shadowy figures are amassing a blistering army that could wreak havoc if unleashed upon Orgrimmar.

The adventurers have been sent to Ragefire Chasm to investigate this potential threat.

boardgame.name: Scholomance
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Individuals seeking to master the powers of undeath know well of Scholomance, the infamous school of necromancy located in the dark and foreboding crypts beneath Caer Darrow. In recent years, several of the instructors have changed, but the institution remains under the control of Darkmaster Gandling, a particularly sadistic and insidious practitioner of necromantic magic.

The adventurers have been sent to Scholomance to defeat the Darkmaster and shut down the school.

boardgame.name: Shadowfang Keep
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Looming over Pyrewood Village from the southern bluffs of Silverpine Forest, Shadowfang Keep casts a shadow as dark as its legacy. Sinister forces occupy these ruins, formerly the dwelling of the mad archmage Arugal's worgen. The restless shade of Baron Silverlaine lingers while Lord Godfrey and his cabal of erstwhile Gilnean noblemen plot against their enemies both living and undead.

The adventurers have been sent to Shadowfang Keep to punish Lord Vincent Godfrey and his followers for their betrayal.

boardgame.name: Uldaman
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Uldaman is an ancient titan vault buried deep within the earth. It is said the titans sealed away a failed experiment there and then moved on to a new project, related to the genesis of the dwarves. Tales of a fabled treasure containing great knowledge have enticed would-be treasure hunters to dig deeper into the secrets of Uldaman, a task made perilous by the presence of stone defenders, savage troggs, Dark Iron invaders, and other dangers lurking in the lost city.

The adventurers have come to Ulduar to uncover its secrets and recover its lost treasures.

boardgame.name: Bucky Lasek's Ramps & Rails
boardgame.description:
Ramps and Rails game play is a mix between a fun chutes and ladders race and an educational tool, which helps children better understand the relationship between numbers and spaces.

Teaches spatial reasoning and math skills.

boardgame.name: Wailing Caverns
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Years ago, the famed druid Naralex and his followers descended into the shadowy Wailing Caverns, named for the mournful cry one hears when steam bursts from the cave system's fissures. Naralex planned to use the underground springs to restore lushness to the arid Barrens. But upon entering the Emerald Dream, he saw his vision of regrowth turn into a waking nightmare, one that has plagued the caverns ever since.

The adventurers have been sent to the Wailing Caverns to aid the Disciples of Naralex in ending the nightmare.

boardgame.name: Duellum
boardgame.description:
Two gladiators face each other in the arena.

Each player choses a card from the 5 available, and they are revealed simultaneously. Effects include damage to your opponent, pushing him on the ground, and raising yourself from the ground. The effect depends also on what your opponent plays - try to guess his move. You can't chose the same action twice in a row.

The first gladiator to inflict at least 5 damage points to the opponent wins.

—description from the designer

Published on History Kids, Italian edition, issue #13.

boardgame.name: The Firesoul Phantom of Keystone Tower
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You feel the immense heat on your skin, beads of sweat already rolling down your spine, and then it appears, wreathed in flames, its face expressionless, distant, alien. Its two ember eyes focus on something on the ground. The phantom's ghastly form floats through the air, extending its spectral hand towards your companion's unconscious body, lying motionless on the floor. Your ears are filled with the roar of the fire and the rhythmic thrumming of the arcane mechanism in the center of the room, like the beating heart of a leviathan that swallowed you all whole. The infernal specter's hand reaches your friend's body and her skin begins to blacken. Moments later it becomes harder to even remember her name...

boardgame.name: The Old Wizard's Tower: The Dragonmaw Chronicles
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

As you crest the latest hill, you see a Tower situated at the top of the next hill, not far away. The tower seems to be very old and in disrepair. It looks to be about 4stories tall with parapets crowned with gargoyle statues. Blocks seem to be missing and windows seem to be broken. The bottom floor has a single Door in its side. The second floor seems to have multiple widows around its perimeter. The third floor has windows and a single stone balcony. The fourth floor seems to have more widows but all that you can see seem shuttered and dark.

A broken down stable sits on the side of the tower, having fallen down long ago. The area seems very quiet and still, as if waiting for something...

boardgame.name: The Three Slaves
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Gurutz "Black Hand" was always a loyal follower of his master, Surtur. Killing, raiding and scheming so that he could obtain more power in order to help his master. It was one cold night, that he received a premonition as he contemplated the flames emerging from his campfire... he could see the church to the false Christian god built upon the valley, he could see how under it there was a door, guarded by half blooded giants, and behind it the place where his master guided him.

boardgame.name: Vecna's Last Supper
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Vecna's Last Supper is a silly and light-hearted one-shot adventure designed for four Level 1 characters. Based on the number of encounters, it should take between 3-4 hours to complete.

boardgame.name: Zombie Apocalypse Campaign
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Zombie Apocalypse Campaign doesn’t use races and classes the same way that Dungeons & Dragons Fifth Edition does. Instead, all characters are human and they all fall under a single class: Survivor. Furthermore, backgrounds act as both the “race” and “origin” for a character, offering up roleplaying notes and traits.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Daughters of Khaine
boardgame.description:
Guided by the will of Morathi, their mysterious and cunning ruler, Khaine’s faithful go forth in search of conquest and sacrifice.

With their mix of highly-mobile, aggressive units, empowering sorcery, and deadly Heroes, this is an army that wants to get in their opponents face. This battletome will help generals make the most of their unusual abilities and tactics. Customise your army to your preferred play style with six different Temples of Khaine, each with their own abilities, traits, and Artefacts of Power. This essential guide also contains a wealth of updated background material detailing the aftermath of events in Broken Realms: Morathi, painting guides, and stunning art.

This 104-page hardback book contains:


Allegiance abilities for the Daughters of Khaine, including a variety of battle traits
6 Temples of Khaine, including abilities, command traits, and Artefacts of Power.
Lore of Shadows spell table
Prayers of the Khainite Cult prayer table
1 Ceremony of Blood battleplan
Rules for creating a Daughters of Khaine warband for Path to Glory, including Champion and Followers Rewards Tables
7 warscroll battalions
23 warscrolls, including 2 endless spells and 1 Invocation of Khaine warscroll
Pitched battle profiles for all units and endless spells featured in this battletome.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition) Core Rules

boardgame.name: Bear Attack
boardgame.description:
To survive a Bear Attack, you don't have to outrun the Bear, you just have to outrun your friends.

A strategy game for 2-6 players - Campers roll dice to move around the board and use Camper Cards to hide and sabotage other Campers. At the end of each round, the Bear Die is rolled. The Bear either moves toward the closest Camper or a Bear Card is drawn. If the Bear catches you, you're eaten and out of the game.

With Caves to pass through, a Base Tree to hide in and placeable obstacles, multiple strategies prove effective as Campers try to be the last Camper standing.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shadows Under Emystrell
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The night streets of Emystrell are as silent as a graveyard and with half of one’s grisly charm. A creeping fog slithers between the lonely homes adding to the sense of isolation to those who tremble with fear inside. A warm light bobbing through the impenetrable darkness is held aloft by a pair of nervous guards who keep their eyes peeled for any danger that might lurk in the deeping shadows. The tallest of the two guards holds onto her shortsword to try and keep from nervously shaking. Whenever she is afraid, her voice drops an octave to cover her nerves.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Nightwind
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome and thank you for downloading this adventure. Temple of the Nightwind is a short adventure suited for new players and new dungeon masters alike. It works best for characters of 2th level and lasts about two to three hours. To run Temple of the Nightwindas a DM, you‘ll need the Players Handbook or the D&D 5e Basic Rules. If you feel like the encounters in this adventure are too hard or too easy, feel free to add or substract monsters as you see fit. Magic Items and Monsters are explained at the end of this document. Happy gaming!

boardgame.name: Das Ist Nicht Das Ende
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Wir finden das nicht gerecht! Hexen, Dämonen und Teufel treiben alltäglich ihr Unwesen, doch nur zu Halloween wird ihnen die Aufmerksamkeit zuteil, die sie auch verdienen. Friedliche Kürbisse werden jährlich für einen Feiertag massakriert und ausgestellt, doch am meisten tun uns die Zombies leid. In Videospielen, Filmen und auch in Pen&Paper-Abenteuern stehen sie tapfer und jederzeit bereit, lassen sich in Scharen niedermetzeln und niemand versucht das Ganze mal aus ihrer Perspektive zu sehen.

boardgame.name: Can't Touch This
boardgame.description:
An abstract in-hand game for 1-2 players in which players sequentially slide paperclips onto a card in order to capture symbols. Each symbol has a different effect, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins (for solo, the goal is to earn the most points). The game has light area control strategies, and generally rewards capturing many of the same kind of symbol.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Trekking Through History: Time Warp Expansion
boardgame.description:
Time Warps create layers of tactics and strategy in Trekking Through History by giving you special powers you can only use once per round, often involving how you use and bend time.

Because you can only use each Time Warp once, you'll need impeccable timing to make the most of them. There are 24 Time Warps in total, and 3 are in play each game, leading to 2024 unique situations to play through!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trekking Through History: Solo Mode
boardgame.description:
Trekking Through History's Solo Mode lets you challenge an automated opponent known as The Historian. The Historian can create obstacles for you a human opponent can't, like destroying your time crystals or preventing you from visiting your ancestors.

Solo players can choose 4 levels of difficulty: Easy, Normal, Hard and Extreme (for the masochists among you).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Port Royal: Ausbilderin Promo
Port Royal: Az instruktor
Port Royal: Die Ausbilderin
Port Royal: Instructor Promo Set
Port Royal: The Instructor
boardgame.description:
The Instructor is a promo card pack consisting of 9 cards (4x Person card Instructor, 5x Ships) that can be played together with the Port Royal Big Box. In addition, the marked playing cards from Port Royal: Unterwegs!, all playing cards of the expansion Just One more Contract and the promo card "Player" can also be added to the game.

The ability of the new person (The Instructor) allows you to swap in the Trade & Hire phase. You can put 1 card per instructor from your own display (including the instructor) into the harbor display and put 1 card from the harbor display, which is at most 2 more expensive, into your own display in exchange.
An effect from the expansion Just One More Contract is available on two of the new Ships. in addition to the 3 Coins gained when taking this Ship, one other player of your choice also gains 1 Coin. (As usual, the Coins are taken from the Play deck, and you must also pay the active player 1 Coin if you are not the active player.)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: AOC: Age of Champagne
boardgame.description:
AoC English Description



AoC - Age of Champagne puts you in the shoes of a young Cellar Master who inherits a family winery.

In competitive mode, among many possible actions, you will have to make wise investments, optimize the processing of your precious grapes to meet the demands of the different markets. 3 versatile workers are just waiting for your instructions to support you in your strategy.

The Cellar Master at the head of the most prestigious and eco-responsible Champagne Maison at the end of the 10th harvest will be elected Cellar Master of the Decade and win the Game.


AoC Description en Français



AoC - Age of Champagne vous plonge dans la peau d'un jeune Chef de cave qui hérite du domaine viticole familial.

En mode compétitif, parmi de nombreuses actions possibles, vous devrez faire des investissements judicieux, optimiser la transformation de vos précieux raisins pour répondre aux demandes des différents marchés. 3 ouvriers polyvalents n'attendent que vos instructions pour vous accompagner dans votre stratégie.

Le Chef de Caves à la tête de la Maison de Champagne la plus prestigieuse et éco-responsable à l'issue de la 10ème vendange sera élu Chef de Caves de la Décennie et remportera la partie.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

boardgame.name: Les Souris gloutonnes
boardgame.description:
"Qui rapportera le plus de fromage ?"
"Wie zal de meeste kaasblokjes binnenhalen?"
"Who will bring back the largest number of cheese-dice?"

—description from the front of the box

Similar to Hungry Hungry Hippos, 2 players control mice using magnets under the board to bring cheese to their corner as fast as possible. Whoever has the most cheese when all cheese dice have been collected wins.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Gyojin Fighter Sushido
boardgame.description:
The mist of a spring morning… a gentle wind carries cherry blossom petals, a stream whispers in the undergrowth, and suddenly, the birds fall silent. Two silhouettes face each other and exchange a long look. Then, they leap forward, ready to have their blades sing at the pace of the war drums. A brutal fight starts in the Arena: it can only end in a knockout.

Gyojin Fighter Sushido is a 2-player game that was inspired by the best 1v1 fighting video games, where characters fight each other in a merciless duel. Create Katas and Combos to deliver powerful hits using your Action Cards, preserve your Health Points, and knock out your opponent to become the Winner of the Arena!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lay On Hands
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Lay On Hands is a solo roleplaying game with a dexterity element, in which the player is a healer in a post-apocalyptic world.

The setting is left to the player to define, using the provided tables if needed as inspiration, while the character is chosen from a list of archetypes. The main resolution mechanic depends on the use of an oracle table, on which the player spins a coin. While the coin is spinning, the player must complete a number of activities (depending on the difficulty of the task) on a maze-like drawing on the back cover of the book, such as filling boxes with a pen, or connecting boxes, or adding together some numbers and writing the result. The oracle table on which the coin spins has a number of boxes containing narrative prompts; where the coin lands on the oracle table, and if it lands on head or tails, can be used as inspiration for the narrative as needed.

boardgame.name: Agartha
boardgame.description:
Rolhnir has spent his whole life exploring subterranean worlds. He left a legacy of an inestimable value: the Maps of Agartha. You are his descendants, ready to pick up the torch and explore the world. To find the secret maps of your ancestor, you must walk in his tracks and wander through unknown lands to gather information.
Perform as many explorations as possible, meet new people, and collect items to prove yourself worthy of your glorious ancestor. Find the lost maps of the world of Agartha!

At the beginning of each round, players will use their auction chips to retrieve resources on the expedition tiles. They have to bet to get cards of different kinds, which they will have to place as best they can on their personal board. One goal: maximize these resources and multiply combos! Explore as many places as you can, meet characters, and collect sacred amulets to learn as much as you can about the underground worlds of Agartha.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine (Volume 14 - Jan 2022)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Content:

Variations: Emotional Quest Adventures
Tool Box: More Flowcharts!

boardgame.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 35 - Winter 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the 40th anniversary year of Star Frontiers and issue 35 of the Frontier Explorer. This issue starts with a throwback to the early days of the game with an article by Richard Rose about one of the first ships he designed even before he had the Knight Hawks rules. He also gives us a Knight Hawks adventure later in the issue.

Tom Verreault continues the starship theme with an article about starship computer systems, He also gives us a couple of alternate rule systems for beginning character skills and backgrounds.

A second theme for this issue is cadres and organizations which we get across three articles by three different authors: Tom Verreault, Ken Wang, and Oscar Rios.

We also have an article from Oscar that was supposed to go in the last issue, but we missed due to a communication mix-up. The issue ends with a planetary brief by Oscar and the first installment of a fiction piece by Rod McDonough.

The complete article list for this issue is:

Starling Class Light Transport
Demystifying Starship Computer Systems
Section 13
The Sisters of Charitable Retribution
Grub Across the Stars
Beginning Character Blues
Hidden Horrors of Star Frontiers
Space Battlefields: Interactive Quantum Radar Map Assets
The Heist
Raised by Wolves?
Planetary Brief – Circe
The Invasion of Gran Quivera
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Space Battlefields: Interactive Quantum Radar Map Assets

boardgame.name: Born on the Bayou
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Broken down on the road to Camp Hope, the survivors encounter a scouting party from an antique paddle steamer roaming the Mississippi River.

Born on the Bayou is the fourth episode in The Living Dead Campaign. This non-traditional Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: Mother's Brood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Under Kingdom!

They say you’re never too far from a rat. But in the Kingdom, there are worse things than rats...

You’ve heard the stories. Your brother’s best friend’s uncle’s servant’s niece saw a ratman once. It was dressed in a ragged cloak, naked tail bobbing behind it as it ran, hunched over, clutching something close to its chest. The niece, though terrified, ran after it; watched it as it pulled up the sewer grate and jumped, feet first, into the muck below. Of course, nobody else was around. Nobody else saw this happen. Can’t be true.

Can it..?

boardgame.name: Sharkano!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A blistering shark scenario for Trailer Park Shark Attack!

In Sharkano!, the trailer park is flooded with super-heated water and Lava Sharks. Just like other scenarios for TPSA!, pick a character at random. If you become fish food during the game, pick another ‘Parker and keep playing.
TPSA! is a disaster shark adventure designed for use with Savage Worlds. You need TPSA! to play Sharkano!.

In this fast, furious, and fun adventure, you determine which scenes and dilemmas to use in a hot-water-filled trailer park near an erupting volcano under a caldera lake. Like the original TPSA! scenarios, we use a three-act structure with variable scenes. Sharkano! has its own plot line and new monster sharks.

You can’t swim? You might wanna start sayin’ your prayers.
The pdf version of Sharkano! comes with the following:

Description of the Sharkano! scenario, along with 7 new incidents the GM can choose from to use during the game, and a recommended final climactic scene.
Map pages to print and assemble the 18" x 24" map for the final scene.
New Setting Rules and Tips and Tricks For Running TPSA!
Character Cards for four (4) new 'Parkers designed for this scenario.
Stat Cards for new sharks, nonplayers, and vehicles (and printable paper minis for the sharks).

boardgame.name: Starfall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The daoren are offered a rush mission to locate a crashed satellite and return the data drives to their contact. Easy, right? Not when the satellite landed in the interior of the Baja Peninsula, one of the most isolated, lawless, dangerous places on 2050s Earth. The group quickly discovers that completing their mission means threading the needle between frightened, xenophobic villagers and the military strongman that rules them. They might also find that death comes quickly in the searing Baja wastelands.

Starfall is a cyberpunk adventure for New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America, which uses the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game rules.
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: Primary Attribute
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A passing storm creates havoc in more ways than one, as a cohort of lab animals escapes from a biolab in the aftermath. The heroes are contracted to quietly recapture the animals, but they quickly meet their match as they learn the little creatures have had their intelligence boosted…and they’re becoming smarter yet. Meanwhile, a group of angry citizens and an unseen foe create more complications. Will the adventurers succeed in their task, or fail due to the forces of popular rage and shadowy scheming?

Primary Attribute is a short science fiction adventure using the Cepheus Engine (CE), Cepheus Deluxe (CD) and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) rules.

boardgame.name: Ninja: Silent But Deadly – Stealth Pack
boardgame.description: The 6 card Stealth Pack consists an extra 6 Ninja cards, but these each have the website and directions at the bottom. You can use these to extend the size of the game night metagame, but you can also use these to leave with friends (or enemies) without breaking up your Wallet Game. Plus the directions will guide them to the website where they can learn how to Ninja themselves.

boardgame.name: эрудит (Erudite)
boardgame.description:
This crossword strategy game is in Russian language with small magnetic Cyrillic alphabet letter tiles. Played with 2-4 players.

Erudite, also called SlovoEd or Scrab (Scrabble) is a small travel game with Cyrillic letter magnetic tiles (black with white letters & point numbers). It is quite similar to English Scrabble, though it is my understanding that there are variations in the rules that are different (ex. can be played with 5 tiles per player instead of 7).

Good for any Russian speakers or a perfect learning aid for anyone learning Russian.

boardgame.name: Oak and Thorn
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is intended as a cozy, festive, feel-good one shot for parties of 4-5 players of any level.

It is set in the affluent market town of Boscage (which you can locate anywhere you choose to fit your campaign).

boardgame.name: Three Men and a Cheese (To Say Nothing of the Dog...)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Three men walk into a pub with a cheese they need to deliver to the next town. It seems straight forward... doesn't it?

Get your party thinking outside the box with this seemingly innocuous hell-ride through inclemently weathered valleys, deceptively sinister forests and bee-infested monasteries, all in the company of an innocent cheese and a very persistent dog...

boardgame.name: The Golden Fish
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Once thought to be a myth as old as time itself, the Golden Fish is actually an artifact of immense power that has the ability to grant a powerful wish. The artifact fell into one of the archives of the dreaded Witch King, the lich Zhengyi, located in the Bloodstone Lands near the kingdom of Damara. When the Witch King fell, the Great Archive closed and fell quiet.

Now the Great Archive has been found. Will the dangers of Zhengyi’s Legacy threaten Damara yet again?

An adventure for 5th - 7th level characters

boardgame.name: Berdusk Till Dawn
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The party is summoned to Berdusk by Mayor Griffith Hawkins. The trade city is haunted and only brave heroes can save it before it’s too late. The adventurers are thrust into spooky encounters, fighting a variety of undead. The featured encounter occurs at the local tavern where the party must fend off a siege of vampire spawn.

The players will ride a wagon to Berdusk, meet with the mayor, rendezvous at the Tiefling Twister tavern, fight off hordes of invading vampire spawn, and take on the responsible powerful vampire lord.

boardgame.name: Three Orcs and a Baby
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The adventuring party is hired by a local merchant (Delric Nightbreeze) to ambush a black market wagon being brought in by the Night Masks, a criminal organization from Berdusk who are expanding out this way.

The party is encouraged to disguise themselves as the Zhentarim, the local criminals who aren’t too happy about the arrival of the Night Masks.

Starting a war between the two groups and ridding the city of at least one of them is the hope. There’s extra gold for the party if they leave one Night Mask alive to spread the story.

Their primary goal however is to acquire an enchanted crate and its contents for the merchant.

boardgame.name: Ten City Adventures
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ten linked (or not) adventures for any city in any campaign, including additional resources for running the setting.

boardgame.name: The Reliquary
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A (mostly) non-lethal dungeon focused on teamwork and puzzles, for any level.

boardgame.name: The Tournament of Tokens
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The adventure begins with the party arriving in town for the competition. There is a festive excitement throughout the town with plenty of street vendors, crowds and streamers throughout.

Approaching the town square, they will see the majority of the townsfolk gathered around what looks like a set of cellar doors. Standing on a nearby podium is a woman with dark skin and thick black hair pulled back in a long ponytail. She is in the middle of addressing the town.

User summary:

The PDF scenario is distributed with two print-and-play PNG files (a map and a handout).

boardgame.name: A Town on the Edge
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The characters have found themselves in the small mining town of Vathirond, the last stop before the Mournlands. Whether there for business or pleasure, they are now awaiting the train home.

User summary:

The PDF scenario is distributed with a ZIP archive of eight PNG-formatted, print-and-play maps.

boardgame.name: リトルレギオン (Little Legion)
boardgame.description:
リトルレギオン (Little Legion) is a two player card game from Japan. Players build a tableau of three cards in three columns (similar to games like Battle Line). Likewise, players are building scoring combos to claim the different keys as prizes.

The deck has 35 cards, from 1 to 7 in five colours.

Each round, 3 fresh keys are drawn from a bag and placed as a line between the players. The deck is shuffled, and five cards are dealt face-up alongside the keys. Each player is dealt three hand cards, and gets a player aid showing the possible combos.

On their turn, a player draws a card and then plays a card to the tableau, or discards and pulls a face-up card to the tableau instead. Whenever a player completes a column on three cards, they draw one more card and discard from their hand.

Cards can be played face-down to a column. A player can discard two cards, and use a discard from the other players side instead.

When the three keys have three cards set on both sides, any face-down cards are turned up. Equal combos do not get a key, otherwise the winning combo claims a key.

The deck is shuffled over for the next round and fresh keys are pulled from the bag to make up the line.

Play continues until one player wins enough keys.
user summary

boardgame.name: Spirit Island: Feather & Flame
boardgame.description:
Contains:
- Spirit Island: Promo Pack 1
- Spirit Island: Promo Pack 2

With the onset of the dangerous invaders, blighting the lands with their harmful practices and aggression, we spirits have had to grow and change in ways unanticipated. Whether we are water, fire, beneath, or beyond, we answer — these white-sailed ships must turn and go, or be broken on the rocks of our discontent.

Fire and flood, flame and feather; ancient powers waken to free their home from a unique adversary’s influence. Can the island survive such turmoil?
